results.title: On call to a nation
results.creator_credit: Richard Cawston and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A review, consisting of many interviews with doctors of the British National Health Service ten years after it was started. Country and city general practitioners, specialists, public health doctors and hospital personnel discuss the failures and successes of the scheme, the emergence of partnerhsips, group practices and health centres, the shortage of dentists, and the growing gap between specialists and general practitioners, hospital deficiencies and the difficulties of the coutry practitioner with a small scattered population.

results.title: On borrowed time: the potter farm plan in action
results.brief_description: An eight part series which acts as a practical guide to farming with nature rather than against it and of realising the sustainability of the land, winning the war against soil degradation and maintaining productivity. Examines planning farm layout, water access and management, pasture and crop production, planting natural vegetation, fencing and siting of farms. Narrated by Neil Inall.

results.title: On borrowed time: Bruce Ellison
results.creator_credit: James Ricketson, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implication of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about Bruce Ellison who has muscular dystrophy.

results.title: On a Sunday he went fishing
results.creator_credit: Sarah Mifsud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sarah Mifsud’s father was an avid fisherman as was his father before him. Mifsud tells of the ordinary Sunday which turned tragically extraordinary for her family and the journey to rebuild in the aftermath.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Mifsud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: On a moonlit night
results.creator_credit: Lina Wertmüller, Fulvio Lucisano, Raidue, Carthago Films, Istituto Luce and Italian International Film
results.brief_description: John Knot is a man of the world and a lover of freedom and adventure. After years of reporting on wars, he devotes himself to reporting on the “plague of the century”, AIDS. Years ago while working together in Lebanon, John and Massimo, a young Italian photographer, met a woman photographer, Joelle. She and John had an affair and then suddenly one day she disappeared. Whilst travelling the world with Masimo, pretending to be HIV positive in order to record reactions from different people, he meets Joelle again in a Paris newspaper office. They make a vow never to separate again, but fate has other plans for them. Starring Rutger Hauer, Natassja Kinski, Faye Dunaway, Peter O’Toole and Lorraine Bracco. Costumes designed by Gianni Versace.

results.title: On a budget
results.creator_credit: Chris Farrell, Peter Lindon and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Offers families advice on how to budget and save for the future in five 10 minute programmes. This series is recommended viewing for parents with young families, and offers practical and easy to implement strategies on a wide range of issues to do with parenting.

results.title: Omni
results.brief_description:
Finbar is a young man who is obsessed with pi. His fragile existence is thrown into tumult when he discovers a mysterious note in his locker…

Under the category ‘Secondary Live Action’, Blake Whelan, ACT, was the Screen It 2012 winner.
